reviewText:
Lets face it we all hate nexons customer service, but they do make some great titles games that grip you. COming from vindictus this game seem like a childs game but in the long run has great pvp system. The controls are very responsive and has great comabt mechanics. The community is very helpful and enjoys running things together. Raids are a challange and you can find yourself face down in the dirt real quick. If you are a fan of any action mmo then you should try out dragon nest. They have introduced the new assassin class which is super bad ♥♥♥, you want crazy dps all I have to say is shinobi.

Pros: great community, awesome pve, great mechanics and great anime style graphics, Dont need a top end pc, crazy good pvp including more then one pvp mode, not an over priced store.

Cons: Grind fest which can lead to a headache, nexon customer service(have better luck in forums). SInce it is free to play there are outfits which boost stats (they do have free offers to do for currency), so you can consider this slighty pay to win( in pvp) but i have seen people whip ♥♥♥ a free to play. Combos have a slight learning curve which can lead to frustration when pvping against a temptest who knwos roation are any class for that matter.

reviewText:
Dragon Nest is a typical free-to-play MMORPG that you can play solo or with partying with friends. It doesn't offer anything really special compared to other MMOs and it is extremely casual.

The graphics are alright and the music is pretty good, the gameplay is fluid... But, that's far from being the issue i'm having with this game. Pay-to-win usually is, you know, somewhat bad and it makes you stronger than players who don't pay or it takes longer to achieve a certain level of power... But in Dragon Nest it's an entirely new story.

I started a new character and I was questing with a friends, Monsters took about 3-4 hits each and using spells usually one or two shotted them, you know, pretty standard... Until we earned NX gear from our Reward Chest" at around level 9 (you obtain one of those everytime you level up). It was a full set of NX (paid) gear that lasts 7 days. Now
date: the monsters I was fighting at around this level had about 50 health maybe... And I was hitting around 10-15 damage with my basic attacks.\n\nWell
hoursPlayed: I was hitting around 4000 with my basic attacks and the monsters were just as weak as before! So for the next few levels
voteText: I was 1 hitting everything
helpfulPercent: including bosses with my basic attack... How fun!\n\nAlso
votesHelpful: in your "Reward Chest" you can find "Goddess's Laments". They're used to craft armour
votesTotal: weapons and jewelry... But
votesFunny: they have only implemented armour and weapons for the older classes or something
commentsCount: because if you play a Machina
column16: you can only craft jewelry with those crafting materials and nothing else!\n\nAnother thing
column17: if you have played this game before and you want to play it on Steam
column18: you can never get the Steam exclusive mount
column19: because you need a fresh account to obtain it.\n\nOverall
column20: the game is way too easy
column21: anyone could play it with the paid gear you are given and you get it every few levels it seems. I wouldn't bother playing such a game."

reviewText:
Dragon Nest is probably one of the best MMO RPGs out there. It's amazing, and just because it's free to play, doesn't mean you have to buy to progress. The only things you buy are costumes, but, there are better costumes you can wear without paying. I've played around 70 hours, and the campaign still hasn't stopped!

Also, the gameplay is never TOO grindy or easy, It's actually really cool!

It seems to be something similar to Final Fantasy, but i'd recommend it much more.

reviewText:
Dragons Nest, this is not a bad game for free, its rather amuzing and fun.. its just a little dated with graphics, and i guess i can expect that being its going on 2 years old. Is this game worth playintg, sure.. why not.. its fast paced, easy controls, fun gameplay. I mean for free it dont get much better then that. Of course you have the option to buy items in store, but i have not really taken the time to look into their store since there is not much of a community playing the game, so i rather not put any money into buying any cool items from their store as i would see it as a waste.

I do recommend this game if you are bored and looking for something to pass the time for a couple weeks while you wait for your next game to be released or something like that.

I will definitly be watching out for a part 2 of this game if it ever comes out, hopefully it will full the community.
